docs.title: Overview
docs.text: SuperMaze is a browser-based maze game built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Players navigate from the start point to the end point of a maze. The project also supports an optional WebSocket server for multiplayer features and a leaderboard.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Smooth WASD movement
  • Dynamic maze generation
  • Reset and restart options
  • Victory screen
  • Optional leaderboard with player scores

docs.title: Assets
docs.text:
• assets/maze_tiles.png: Maze wall and floor graphics
  • assets/player.png: Player icon or sprite

docs.title: Controls
docs.text:
• W: Move Up
  • A: Move Left
  • S: Move Down
  • D: Move Right
  • Reset Button: Restarts the current maze

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text:
• Open index.html in any browser for local play.
  • To host online:
  • Push project to GitHub
  • Deploy via GitHub Pages or any static host
  • Ensure server features are accessible if using WebSocket leaderboard

docs.title: Maze Generation
docs.text:
• Maze can be procedural or manually defined.
  • Grid is represented as a 2D array.
  • Walls are obstacles; paths are navigable.

docs.title: Player Movement
docs.text:
• Controlled via keyboard events (keydown).
  • Collision detection prevents walking through walls.
  • Smooth movement is implemented using requestAnimationFrame.

docs.title: Victory Conditions
docs.text:
• Player wins by reaching the maze’s end point.
  • Victory triggers a screen display and optional leaderboard update.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Modern web browser
  • Optional: Node.js for WebSocket server and leaderboard
  • Python + MkDocs if using local documentation

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository:
git clone https://github.com/kessud2021/SuperMaze
cd SuperMaze

Open index.html in a browser to run the game.

Optional: Run WebSocket Server

cd server
npm install
node server.js

docs.title: Leaderboard
docs.text:
• Maintains top players and scores.
  • Can use local storage or WebSocket server.
  • Files: leaderboard.html, leaderboard.js.

docs.title: Score Submission
docs.text:
1. Detect victory
  2. Send score to server or store locally
  3. Display top scores

docs.title: Initialization
docs.text:
• Loads maze layout
  • Sets player starting position
  • Binds keyboard events

docs.title: Event Handling
docs.text:
• keydown listens for WASD inputs
  • Validates movement against walls

docs.title: Maze Rendering
docs.text:
• Renders maze using canvas or DOM elements
  • Updates player position in real-time
  • Refreshes display each frame

docs.title: WebSocket Server
docs.text:
• Simple Node.js server using the ws library.
  • Handles multiplayer or leaderboard connections.

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Install dependencies:
npm install ws

Start server:

node server.js

Connect from the game using WebSocket URL.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Maze does not load: Check the maze array or generation function in script.js.
  • Controls not responding: Ensure page is focused and keydown events are correctly bound.
  • Leaderboard not updating: Verify server is running and the connection URL is correct.
